title: Using Smaller Labs for Virus Testing, Mark Carney Joins Brookfield, U.S. Produced Chemicals Fuel Mexican Drug Cartels
itunes:title: Using Smaller Labs for Virus Testing, Mark Carney Joins Brookfield, U.S. Produced Chemicals Fuel Mexican Drug Cartels
description:
We set the Businessweek Agenda with Bloomberg Intelligence Chief Equity Strategist Gina Martin Adams and Bloomberg Stocks Editor Dave Wilson. Ali Davar, Co-Founder of Atlas ID, explains how smaller, emerging-growth labs and tech companies can deliver Covid results faster. Bloomberg News Deals Reporter Scott Deveau shares news that Former Bank of England governor Mark Carney is joining on Brookfield Asset Management to lead the firm’s expansion into ESG funds. Bloomberg Businessweek Editor Joel Weber and Bloomberg News Projects & Investigations Reporter Cam Simpson discuss how the U.S. drug crisis is made in Mexico with American raw materials. Bloomberg News Labor Reporter Josh Eidelson talks about miners trying to move on after President Trump's coal comeback never materialized. And we Drive to the Close with Charlie Rodgers, Regional Chief Investment Officer at Abbot Downing.

Hosts: Carol Massar and Jason Kelly. Producer: Paul Brennan

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
